stand up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to be on your feet, or to rise to your feet
stand up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I’ve been standing up all day.
Stand up straight and don’t slouch!
stand up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to stay healthy or in good condition in a difficult environment or after a lot of hard use
stand up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Most of the plants stood up well to the heat.
stand up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to be proved to be true, correct, useful etc when tested
stand up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Without a witness, the charges will never stand up in court (=be successfully proved in a court of law).
The memoirs stand up well to cross-checking with other records.
stand up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to not meet someone who you have arranged to meet
stand up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: I was supposed to go to a concert with Kyle on Friday, but he stood me up.
stand up.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to make it very clear what you think about something when this is dangerous or might cause trouble for you
stand up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: stand-up comedy involves one person telling jokes alone as a performance
stand up.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a stand-up meeting, meal etc is one in which people stand up
stand up.translation[1].definitions[2].d: a stand-up fight, argument etc is one in which people shout loudly at each other or are violent
stand up.translation[1].definitions[2].e: If it came to a stand-up fight, I wouldn’t have a chance.
stand up.translation[1].definitions[3].e: a photo in a stand-up frame
stand up.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Mark used to do stand-up at Roxy’s Bar.
stand up.translation[2].definitions[1].d: a comedian who does stand-up comedy
